column1: Punhana is a town in Punhana sub-division in the Nuh district in the Indian state of Haryana.
Punahana is the largest town of Mewat
column2: at an average elevation of 187 metres (613 feet).

column3: 178. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Punahana has an average literacy rate of 53%
column4: lower than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 63% and female literacy is 41%. In Punahana
column5: 21% of the population is under 6 years of age. The district has a low population when compared to the population density of India.
